JobFullDesc: Cloud Operations + Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers Microsoft’s cloud platforms and services that millions of people use every day. With more than 95% of Fortune 500 business on Azure, 180 million using Office 365, and millions using other services – all running on Microsoft's cloud infrastructure – CO+I builds and operates the foundation upon which Microsoft’s mission to empower every person and organization comes to life. The Datacenter Physical Security (PhysSec) team is organized within CO+I. PhysSec is dedicated to delivering the most trustworthy and efficient physical security services to protect the personnel, infrastructure, data, and confidential information foundational to the Microsoft Cloud. Our vision is to be the most reliable, meticulous, and trusted industry provider of hyperscale cloud physical security. We are accountable, effective, and efficient stewards of the awesome responsibility we hold. We innovate to meet challenges. We automate and simplify to scale efficiently. We constantly create and maintain a collaborative ecosystem. We appreciate and act on opportunities to improve. We are seeking a Security Strategic Initiatives Team Manager, who also functions as a senior level PM, to help us grow our strong team of PM professionals. This role will partner with various levels of stakeholders within Microsoft, as well as suppliers, to plan and execute on strategic initiative projects that improve our physical security program. This person will lead a small team of Strategic Initiative PMs as well as be an Individual Contributor PM on high impact projects. They will proactively share information across the team, leadership, and the broader organization, to the right audience with the appropriate level of detail and timeliness. They must be able to scope problems, collaborate with subject matter experts to develop viable solutions and prioritize the team’s work appropriately while managing multiple concurrent projects across geographical and organizational boundaries. They must also act ethically, with a sense of accountability for end-to-end quality and completeness and demonstrate resilience in times of rapid growth and change. In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day. ResponsibilitiesManage a team of Security Strategic Initiative (SI) PMs through modeling, coaching, and caring, and help them to deliver impactful projects.Assign and prioritize the team’s workload. This role functions as a Team Manager and an Individual Contributor PM; managing project scope, schedule, budget, risk, and quality control activities.Manage and communicate the SI team’s reconciled Capital Expenditures (CAPEX) budget.Ensure SI team projects are delivered in accordance with applicable employment law and company policy.Ensure project related suppliers are compliant with all security controls, policies, and objectives.Ensure project status reports are communicated to the appropriate stakeholders. Ensure that leadership is made initially and continuously aware of any issues, when appropriate, and that the appropriate personnel are managing the issue effectively.Partner and collaborate closely with peer leaders and stakeholders, focused on maintaining a One Microsoft, one team environment.Collaborate with peer teams and organizations to ensure their team is aligned with broader strategy, objectives and key results (OKRs), fully supporting leadership priorities, being good partners, helping reduce costs, time burden, and complexity, and being responsive trusted advisors.Continuously improve the efficiency and maturity of the overall physical security program.Continuously seek data and recommend strategies and ideas to reduce churn, optimize, implement a creative solution to a problem, scale, automate, and simplify.Engage with internal and external customers as appropriate to evangelize and represent Microsoft’s datacenter physical security programs.Maintain confidentiality, discretion, and protect Microsoft information without question.QualificationsRequired Qualifications:A Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in Business or other related field, or equivalent industry experience5+ years of program and/or project management experience2+ years of experience directly leading and supporting a team of employees Preferred Qualifications:Ability to effectively manage a team and projects in a new hybrid working remote and in-office modelExperience managing project budgets (CAPEX); establishing an informed fiscal year baseline and forecasting as neededProficient in the use of Microsoft Office products and Microsoft TeamsProven history of successfully working across teams and managing stakeholders to create strong relationshipsAbility to travel up to 5% of the time in both planned and unplanned scenariosAbility to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role.
